001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.util.AbstractMap;
004import java.util.ArrayList;
005import java.util.Arrays;
006import java.util.LinkedList;
007import java.util.List;
008import java.util.Map;
009import java.util.NavigableMap;
010import java.util.NavigableSet;
011import java.util.SequencedMap;
012import java.util.SequencedSet;
013import java.util.stream.IntStream;
014import java.util.stream.Stream;
015import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
016
017import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreCollectors.toLinkedListReversed;
018import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreCollectors.toLinkedMap;
019import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreCollectors.toLinkedSet;
020import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreCollectors.toListReversed;
021import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreCollectors.toSortedMap;
022import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreCollectors.toSortedSet;
023
024/**
025 * Utility-class that provides methods to transform the stream or var-args-arrays of values into linked or sorted sets
026 * and stream or var-args-arrays of {@link Map.Entry entries} into linked or sorted map.
027 * An enumeration {@link MergeFunction} could be used to handle the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key}.
028 * <hr/>
029 * Some miscellaneous helper utility-methods to work with primitive streams are also added...
030 */
031public class CoreStreamUtils {
032
033    // ===========================================================================================
034    //            Utility-methods to convert IntStreams to List<Integer>
035    // ===========================================================================================
036
037    /**
038     * @param intsArr array of primitive {@code int}s
039     * @return a {@link List} of {@link Integer}
040     */
041    public static List<Integer> intsList(int... intsArr) {
042        return intsList(IntStream.of(intsArr));
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * @param ints stream of primitive {@code int}s
047     * @return a {@link List} of {@link Integer}
048     */
049    public static List<Integer> intsList(IntStream ints) {
050        return ints.boxed().toList();
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * @param startInclusive the lower bound of the range (inclusive)
055     * @param endExclusive the higher bound of the range (exclusive)
056     * @return the {@link List} of all {@link Integer} in the range {@code [ startInclusive ; endExclusive )}
057     */
058    public static List<Integer> intsListRange(int startInclusive, int endExclusive) {
059        return intsList(IntStream.range(startInclusive, endExclusive));
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * @param startInclusive the lower bound of the range (inclusive)
064     * @param endInclusive the higher bound of the range (inclusive)
065     * @return the {@link List} of all {@link Integer} in the range {@code [ startInclusive ; endInclusive ]}
066     */
067    public static List<Integer> intsListRangeClosed(int startInclusive, int endInclusive) {
068        return intsList(IntStream.rangeClosed(startInclusive, endInclusive));
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Un-boxing the stream of {@link Integer}s
073     *
074     * @param integers the stream of {@link Integer}s to un-box
075     * @return the stream of primitive {@code int}s
076     */
077    public static IntStream intStream(Stream<Integer> integers) {
078        return integers.mapToInt(Integer::intValue);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * @param integersList a {@link List} of {@link Integer}
083     * @return the stream of primitive {@code int}s
084     */
085    public static IntStream intStream(List<Integer> integersList) {
086        return intStream(integersList.stream());
087    }
088
089    // ===========================================================================================
090    //        Utility-methods to create a reverse streams from the given array or list
091    // ===========================================================================================
092
093    public static IntStream reversed(int... valuesArr) {
094        return IntStream.rangeClosed(1, valuesArr.length).map(i -> valuesArr[valuesArr.length - i]);
095    }
096    public static IntStream reversed(List<Integer> valuesList) {
097        return IntStream.rangeClosed(1, valuesList.size()).map(i -> valuesList.get(valuesList.size() - i));
098    }
099
100    public static int[] reversedArr(int... valuesArr) {
101        return reversed(valuesArr).toArray();
102    }
103    public static int[] reversedArr(java.util.stream.IntStream values) {
104        return reversedArr(values.toArray());
105    }
106
107    public static ArrayList<Integer> reversedList(int... valuesArr) {
108        return reversedList(Arrays.stream(valuesArr).boxed());
109    }
110    public static ArrayList<Integer> reversedList(IntStream values) {
111        return reversedList(values.boxed());
112    }
113    public static <T> ArrayList<T> reversedList(Stream<T> boxedStream) {
114        return boxedStream.collect(toListReversed());
115    }
116    public static <T> ArrayList<T> reversedList(List<T> valuesList) {
117        return reversedList(valuesList.stream());
118    }
119
120    public static LinkedList<Integer> reversedLinkedList(int... valuesArr) {
121        return reversedLinkedList(Arrays.stream(valuesArr).boxed());
122    }
123    public static LinkedList<Integer> reversedLinkedList(IntStream values) {
124        return reversedLinkedList(values.boxed());
125    }
126    public static <T> LinkedList<T> reversedLinkedList(Stream<T> boxedStream) {
127        return boxedStream.collect(toLinkedListReversed());
128    }
129    public static <T> LinkedList<T> reversedLinkedList(List<T> valuesList) {
130        return reversedLinkedList(valuesList.stream());
131    }
132
133    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
134
135    /**
136     * @param valuesArr var-args-arrays of values
137     * @return the sorted set of those values as {@link NavigableSet}
138     * @param <T> the type of value that must implement {@link Comparable}
139     */
140    @SafeVarargs
141    @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
142    public static <T extends Comparable<T>> NavigableSet<T> sortedSet(T... valuesArr) {
143        return sortedSet(Arrays.stream(valuesArr));
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * @param values stream of values
148     * @return the sorted set of those values as {@link NavigableSet}
149     * @param <T> the type of value that must implement {@link Comparable}
150     */
151    public static <T extends Comparable<T>> NavigableSet<T> sortedSet(Stream<T> values) {
152        return values.collect(toSortedSet());
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * @param valuesIter collection of values as {@link Iterable}
157     * @return the sorted set of those values as {@link NavigableSet}
158     * @param <T> the type of value that must implement {@link Comparable}
159     */
160    public static <T extends Comparable<T>> NavigableSet<T> sortedSet(Iterable<T> valuesIter) {
161        return sortedSet(StreamSupport.stream(valuesIter.spliterator(), false));
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * @param valuesArr var-args-arrays of values
166     * @return the linked set of those values as {@link SequencedSet}
167     * @param <T> the type of value
168     */
169    @SafeVarargs
170    @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
171    public static <T> SequencedSet<T> linkedSet(T... valuesArr) {
172        return linkedSet(Arrays.stream(valuesArr));
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * @param values stream of values
177     * @return the linked set of those values as {@link SequencedSet}
178     * @param <T> the type of value
179     */
180    public static <T> SequencedSet<T> linkedSet(Stream<T> values) {
181        return values.collect(toLinkedSet());
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * @param valuesIter collection of values as {@link Iterable}
186     * @return the linked set of those values as {@link SequencedSet}
187     * @param <T> the type of value
188     */
189    public static <T> SequencedSet<T> linkedSet(Iterable<T> valuesIter) {
190        return linkedSet(StreamSupport.stream(valuesIter.spliterator(), false));
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * A factory-method to produce an instance of {@link Map.Entry} from {@code key} and {@code value}.
195     *
196     * @param key a key of entry to create
197     * @param value a value of entry to create
198     * @return an instance of {@link Map.Entry} as {@link AbstractMap.SimpleEntry}
199     * @param <K> the type of key
200     * @param <V> the type of value
201     */
202    public static <K, V> Map.Entry<K, V> keyValue(K key, V value) {
203        return new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<>(key, value);
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * The same as {@link #keyValue(Object, Object) keyValue(K key, V value)},
208     * but when the type of {@code key} is {@link String} (we can call such {@code key} as {@code name} in this case).
209     *
210     * @param name a name of entry to create
211     * @param value a value of entry to create
212     * @return an instance of {@link Map.Entry} as {@link AbstractMap.SimpleEntry}
213     * @param <V> the type of value
214     */
215    public static <V> Map.Entry<String, V> nameValue(String name, V value) {
216        return keyValue(name, value);
217    }
218
219    /**
220     * Transform the var-args-arrays of entries into the sorted map,
221     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
222     * with the default merge-function {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE}.
223     * <hr/>
224     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
225     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
226     *
227     * @param entriesArr var-args-arrays of entries
228     * @return the sorted map, which is collected from those entries, as {@link NavigableMap},
229     * @param <K> the type of key that must implement {@link Comparable}
230     * @param <V> the type of value
231     */
232    @SafeVarargs
233    @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
234    public static <K extends Comparable<K>, V> NavigableMap<K, V>
235    sortedMap(Map.Entry<K,V>... entriesArr) {
236        return sortedMap(Arrays.stream(entriesArr).filter(CoreStreamUtils::entryIsValid));
237    }
238
239    /**
240     * Transform the var-args-arrays of entries into the sorted map,
241     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
242     * with the passed {@code mergeFunction}.
243     * <hr/>
244     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
245     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
246     *
247     * @param mergeFunction the merge-function to handle the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key}
248     * @param entriesArr var-args-arrays of entries
249     * @return the sorted map, which is collected from those entries, as {@link NavigableMap},
250     * @param <K> the type of key that must implement {@link Comparable}
251     * @param <V> the type of value
252     */
253    @SafeVarargs
254    @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
255    public static <K extends Comparable<K>, V> NavigableMap<K, V>
256    sortedMap(MergeFunction mergeFunction, Map.Entry<K,V>... entriesArr) {
257        return sortedMap(mergeFunction, Arrays.stream(entriesArr));
258    }
259
260    /**
261     * Transform the stream of entries into the sorted map,
262     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
263     * with the default merge-function {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE}.
264     * <hr/>
265     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
266     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
267     *
268     * @param entries stream of entries
269     * @return the sorted map, which is collected from those entries, as {@link NavigableMap},
270     * @param <K> the type of key that must implement {@link Comparable}
271     * @param <V> the type of value
272     */
273    public static <K extends Comparable<K>, V> NavigableMap<K, V>
274    sortedMap(Stream<Map.Entry<K,V>> entries) {
275        return entries.collect(toSortedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, Map.Entry::getValue));
276    }
277
278    /**
279     * Transform the stream of entries into the sorted map,
280     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
281     * with the passed {@code mergeFunction}.
282     * <hr/>
283     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
284     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
285     *
286     * @param mergeFunction the merge-function to handle the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key}
287     * @param entries stream of entries
288     * @return the sorted map, which is collected from those entries, as {@link NavigableMap},
289     * @param <K> the type of key that must implement {@link Comparable}
290     * @param <V> the type of value
291     */
292    public static <K extends Comparable<K>, V> NavigableMap<K, V>
293    sortedMap(MergeFunction mergeFunction, Stream<Map.Entry<K,V>> entries) {
294        return entries.collect(toSortedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, Map.Entry::getValue, mergeFunction));
295    }
296
297    /**
298     * Returns to sorted copy of the passed map {@code mapToSort}
299     *
300     * @param mapToSort the map whose sorted copy to return
301     * @return the sorted copy of the passed map {@code mapToSort}
302     * @param <K> the type of key that must implement {@link Comparable}
303     * @param <V> the type of value
304     */
305    public static <K extends Comparable<K>, V> NavigableMap<K, V>
306    sortedMap(Map<K,V> mapToSort) {
307        return sortedMap(mapToSort.entrySet().stream());
308    }
309
310    /**
311     * Transform the var-args-arrays of entries into the linked map,
312     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
313     * with the default merge-function {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE}.
314     * <hr/>
315     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
316     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
317     *
318     * @param entriesArr var-args-arrays of entries
319     * @return the linked map, which is collected from {@code entries}, as {@link SequencedMap},
320     * @param <K> the type of key
321     * @param <V> the type of value
322     */
323    @SafeVarargs
324    @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
325    public static <K, V> SequencedMap<K, V>
326    linkedMap(Map.Entry<K,V>... entriesArr) {
327        return linkedMap(Arrays.stream(entriesArr).filter(CoreStreamUtils::entryIsValid));
328    }
329
330    /**
331     * Transform the var-args-arrays of entries into the linked map,
332     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
333     * with the passed {@code mergeFunction}.
334     * <hr/>
335     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
336     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
337     *
338     * @param mergeFunction the merge-function to handle the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key}
339     * @param entriesArr var-args-arrays of entries
340     * @return the linked map, which is collected from {@code entries}, as {@link SequencedMap},
341     * @param <K> the type of key
342     * @param <V> the type of value
343     */
344    @SafeVarargs
345    @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
346    public static <K, V> SequencedMap<K, V>
347    linkedMap(MergeFunction mergeFunction, Map.Entry<K,V>... entriesArr) {
348        return linkedMap(mergeFunction, Arrays.stream(entriesArr));
349    }
350
351    /**
352     * Transform the stream of entries into the linked map,
353     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
354     * with the default merge-function {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE}.
355     * <hr/>
356     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
357     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
358     *
359     * @param entries stream of entries
360     * @return the linked map, which is collected from {@code entries}, as {@link SequencedMap},
361     * @param <K> the type of key
362     * @param <V> the type of value
363     */
364    public static <K, V> SequencedMap<K, V>
365    linkedMap(Stream<Map.Entry<K,V>> entries) {
366        return entries.collect(toLinkedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, Map.Entry::getValue));
367    }
368
369    /**
370     * Transform the var-args-arrays of entries into the linked map,
371     * where the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} are merged
372     * with the passed {@code mergeFunction}.
373     * <hr/>
374     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} all invalid entries are filtered out,
375     * where the filter is based on using {@link #entryIsValid(Map.Entry)} function.
376     *
377     * @param mergeFunction the merge-function to handle the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key}
378     * @param entries stream of entries
379     * @return the linked map, which is collected from {@code entries}, as {@link SequencedMap},
380     * @param <K> the type of key
381     * @param <V> the type of value
382     */
383    public static <K, V> SequencedMap<K, V>
384    linkedMap(MergeFunction mergeFunction, Stream<Map.Entry<K,V>> entries) {
385        return entries.collect(toLinkedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, Map.Entry::getValue, mergeFunction));
386    }
387
388    /**
389     * In order to avoid {@link NullPointerException} in JDK's collectors
390     * all entries that are {@code null} or whose key or value is {@code null} should be filtered out.
391     *
392     * @param entry an entry to filter
393     * @return {@code true} if the entry is valid and otherwise - {@code false}
394     */
395    public static boolean entryIsValid(Map.Entry<?,?> entry) {
396        return entry != null && entry.getKey() != null && entry.getValue() != null;
397    }
398
399    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
400
401    private CoreStreamUtils() {
402        // prohibit the creation of utility-class instance
403        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot instantiate utility-class " + getClass().getName());
404    }
405}
